title: Families of the 54th Massachusetts, Union Army
subtitle:
William Gibson served with Co. D under the alias John Saunders. He was recruited from Chatham, where many freedom seekers took refuge from kidnappers sanctioned by the Refugee Slave Act of 1850.

"The Self-Emancipation of Kentucky slave William Gibson"

title: Megha Majumdar
subtitle:
If you want to know what it’s like to be a refugee—to flee, to worry about fake life jackets, to take food aid in a camp and make birthday cake, to turn your life story into a narrative for asylum interviews—may I put this brilliant book on your radar? 

Out next week! pic.twitter.com/Uz8HwT5Y3N
